Module Frogger
Package p4_group_8_repo.Controllers

Class DigitAnimation

java.lang.Object
p4_group_8_repo.Controllers.DigitAnimation
All Implemented Interfaces:
ActorControllers
public class DigitAnimation
extends java.lang.Object
implements ActorControllers
This class is responsible for starting and stopping the animation of the Digit objects in the game.
It uses an AnimationTimer and its different methods.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private ActorControllers controller
    A Controller object that controls the actors in the game
    private int level
    Level of the game chosen by the player.
    private World myStage
    A World object that contains the actors of the game
    private javafx.stage.Stage stage
    Stage of the application
    private javafx.animation.AnimationTimer timer
    AnimationTimer variable for the animation

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    DigitAnimation​(javafx.stage.Stage stage, World myStage, ActorControllers controller, int level)
    Instantiates a new DigitController.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean changeScore()
    Returns if the score of the game has changed or not.
    private void createTimer()
    Creates the animation timer which is used to update the number of the Digit as the user plays the game and their score changes. .
    private void gameEnd()
    Stops the animation and the music at the end of the game.
    int getPoints()
    Gets the points accumulated as the game is played.
    boolean hasGameEnded()
    Returns whether the game has ended or not.
    void mainControl​(long now)
    The main control of the controller is written in this method.
    private void setNumber​(int n)
    Sets the number of the Digit which appears on top of the screen as the user plays the game.
    void start()
    Starts the animation by creating the timer, starting it and playing the game's music.
    (package private) void stop()
    Stops the timer.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • DigitAnimation

      public DigitAnimation​(javafx.stage.Stage stage, World myStage, ActorControllers controller, int level)
      Instantiates a new DigitController.
      Parameters:
      stage - stage of the application
      myStage - the world that the Actors of the game are a part of
      controller - object controller for the controls of the actors
      level - the level of the game chosen by the user

  • Method Details

    • setNumber

      private void setNumber​(int n)
      Sets the number of the Digit which appears on top of the screen as the user plays the game. The digit changes as the score in the game changes.
      Parameters:
      n - the number of the digit

    • createTimer

      private void createTimer()
      Creates the animation timer.

    • gameEnd

      private void gameEnd()
      Stops the animation and the music at the end of the game.

    • stop

      void stop()
      Stops the timer.

    • start

      public void start()
      Starts the animation by creating the timer, starting it and playing the game's music.

    • mainControl

      public void mainControl​(long now)
      The main control of the controller is written in this method.
      Specified by:
      mainControl in interface ActorControllers
      Parameters:
      now - the current timestamp of the frame in nanoseconds

    • hasGameEnded

      public boolean hasGameEnded()
      Returns whether the game has ended or not.
      Specified by:
      hasGameEnded in interface ActorControllers
      Returns:
